title: Drawing, "Design for Textile-Inventory Card", 1952–69
medium: Green, red and pink colored pencil, graphite on white tracing paper fastened to cardboard with four staples
inscribed: Verso in graphite upper left corner: II - 15
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
dimensions:
10 x 10.8cm (3 15/16 x 4 1/4in.)
Other (cardboard mount): 10.2 x 16.4 cm (4 x 6 7/16 in.)
description: Five rows of alternating pinwheel pattern in green, red, green, pink, green color repeats

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Design for Textile-Inventory Card", 1952–69.Green, red and pink colored pencil, graphite on white tracing paper fastened to cardboard with four staples. Gift of Alexander H. Girard. 1969-165-433.
